translated: As It Was Said
The Collection of Groups of Ones
The Third Section
The Pile of Bones

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Ekapuggalassa, bhikkhave, kappaṁ sandhāvato saṁsarato siyā evaṁ mahā aṭṭhikaṅkalo aṭṭhipuñjo aṭṭhirāsi yathāyaṁ vepullo pabbato, sace saṁhārako assa, sambhatañca na vinasseyyā”ti.
analyzed: eka puggalassa bhikkhave kappam sandhāvataḥ sasarataḥ siyā evam mahā aṭṭhikaṅkalaḥ aṭṭhi puñjaḥ aṭṭhirāsi yathā ayam vepullaḥ pabbataḥ sace sahārakaḥ assa sambhatam ca na vinasseyya ati
translated: “Bhikkhus, for one person living for an eon, the pile of bones that has been formed, the pile of bones that has been accumulated, would be greater than Mount Vepulla, if the bones had not perished and if the bone-mound had not decayed.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:🔽“The pile of bones of one person

by the Great Sage.

it is said, is Mount Vepulla,
north of Vulture Peak,

He is the one who brings suffering to an end,
through the destruction of all fetters.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said in “The Greater Discourse on the Destruction of Craving,” in “The Group of Discourses.”
The fourth.
